intro: Straussia oncocarpa var. scoriacea, commonly known as the scoriaceous straussia, is a rare and specialized plant species characterized by its unique morphological features. It typically grows in rocky, acidic soils, often found in high-altitude or coastal environments. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with thick, waxy leaves adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from pale green to reddish hues. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
